# SkillPad

> A desktop GUI for browsing, installing, and managing AI agent skills from skills.sh.

SkillPad is an open-source Tauri desktop app (macOS + Windows) that wraps the skills.sh CLI. It lets users discover skills from a gallery, install them to any agent with one click, and manage global plus project-scoped skills visually.

- Website: https://skillpad.dev
- Download: https://skillpad.dev/download
- GitHub: https://github.com/devxoul/skillpad

## Features

- Browse skills from the skills.sh gallery
- One-click install to any agent (Claude Code, Cursor, Windsurf, etc.)
- Global and project-scoped skill management
- Deep-link install via `skillpad://skill/OWNER/REPO/SKILL-NAME`
- Automatic dark/light theme (follows system preference)
- Built-in auto-updates

## Install URL

To link users directly to a skill install page:

```
https://skillpad.dev/install/OWNER/REPO/SKILL-NAME
```

Replace `OWNER`, `REPO`, and `SKILL-NAME` with the actual values. When opened, this page attempts to launch SkillPad via the `skillpad://` deep link. If SkillPad is not installed, it shows a download prompt.

## Badges

Skill developers can embed badges with their skill name in their README to let users install skills directly.

Badge URL pattern: `https://badge.skillpad.dev/SKILL-NAME/dark.svg` or `https://badge.skillpad.dev/SKILL-NAME/light.svg`

Replace `SKILL-NAME` with the actual skill name (kebab-case). The badge dynamically displays the skill name.

### Dark Badge

Markdown:

```
[![Available on SkillPad](https://badge.skillpad.dev/SKILL-NAME/dark.svg)](https://skillpad.dev/install/OWNER/REPO/SKILL-NAME)
```

### Light Badge

Markdown:

```
[![Available on SkillPad](https://badge.skillpad.dev/SKILL-NAME/light.svg)](https://skillpad.dev/install/OWNER/REPO/SKILL-NAME)
```

### Shields.io Badge

For a compact shields.io-style badge:

```
[![SkillPad](https://img.shields.io/badge/SkillPad-SKILL--NAME-1a1a1a?style=flat&logo=data%3Aimage%2Fsvg%2Bxml%3Bbase64%%3D%3D)](https://skillpad.dev/install/OWNER/REPO/SKILL-NAME)
```

Replace `OWNER`, `REPO`, and `SKILL-NAME` in both the badge text and the link URL. Hyphens in SKILL-NAME must be doubled (`--`) in the shields.io badge text parameter.

### Badge Examples

- `vercel-labs/skills/find-skills` badge: `[![Available on SkillPad](https://badge.skillpad.dev/find-skills/dark.svg)](https://skillpad.dev/install/vercel-labs/skills/find-skills)`
- `devxoul/agent-messenger/agent-slack` badge: `[![Available on SkillPad](https://badge.skillpad.dev/agent-slack/dark.svg)](https://skillpad.dev/install/devxoul/agent-messenger/agent-slack)`
